p: The distribution changes were strongly governed by the general increases of temperature. In particular, the strong temperature increases over north-eastern Europe and the Mediterranean area in spring and autumn played a role in this regard. Furthermore, changes of the precipitation pattern in summer, with increases over north-eastern Europe and strong decreases over the Mediterranean area as well as southern and western Europe, accounted for the changes, specifically for An. messeae and An. sergentii. Since both, and in particular An. sergentii, heavily rely on summer rainfall, their occurrence probabilities were noticeably reduced until the end of the 21st century.
